title: Associate Experience Designer
content:
At AKQA we believe in the imaginative application of art and science to create beautiful ideas, products and services. With an entrepreneurial and collaborative approach, we design adaptive digital services and applications that capture the imagination, delivering impressive returns for our clients.
Experience Designers at AKQA live at the intersection of strategy, creativity and research to design meaningful, user-centric experiences that meet the needs of brands and their audiences. Combining empathy, communication skills and systems thinking they work collaboratively within multi-disciplinary teams to deliver innovative solutions for any space, channel or device.
The role of the Associate Experience Designer is to deliver discrete components of work within a larger project, or smaller-scale projects, under a degree of supervision and guidance. Using their core understanding of UCD, the Associate Experience Designer will be involved in the delivery of detailed UX design deliverables such as audits, information architecture, user journeys, wireframes and other deliverables. They will contribute and collaborate with the team to ensure a great experience for the user and the right results for the business.
Located in Berlin, Germany, as part of the AKQA team, you will work in an environment that fosters a dynamic and meritocratic culture, surrounded by some of the brightest minds in their fields. 
THE ROLE

Brief interpretation - able to interpret a brief, identify knowledge gaps and review the objectives and KPIs.
Planning - choose correct deliverables for a project under direction of a senior team member.
Process – understand, apply and advocate user-centred design techniques and processes, from project initiation through to on-going product evolution.
Understanding – working with other team members to understand the insights gained from existing and primary research, and know how to apply these to a project.
Research – support the planning, set up and running of user testing and research.
Design - production of clear, carefully-crafted UX deliverables such as site maps, wireframes, user journeys, prototypes, experience maps, audits etc. that ultimately help create award-winning experiences.
Software and tools – confident knowing the right tools to use for each job, and how to use them.
Client – good understanding of the roles of different disciplines within AKQA and how UX can complement and collaborate with them to service the client.

 QUALITIES AND EXPERIENCE

Experience working with standard UX, UCD and service design processes.
Experience making insight-driven decisions powered by data and research.
Experience working with design systems and across multiple platforms.
Collaborative and pragmatic approach to work.
Confident explaining designs and solutions to the wider team.
A natural problem solver – asking the right questions to get to the answer.
Understanding of good usability and accessibility practices.
Able to deliver work to the highest possible standards at all times - on time and within budget.
Able to work in a fast-paced environment – demonstrating flexibility and adaptability.
Be responsible for your ongoing learning, research and self-improvement.
Understanding of different digital platforms, technologies and content management systems.
Confident using industry standard design tools – Sketch, Figma, Flinto etc.
Degree or equivalent work experience in a related field, such as Interaction Design, Product Design, Industrial Design, Graphic Design etc. is preferred.
